metadata.title: CVE-2010-1457 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Tools/gdomap.c in gdomap in GNUstep Base before 1.20.0 allows local usersto read arbitrary files via a (1) -c or (2) -a option, which prints filecontents in an error message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-1457` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnustep-base-common - 1.24.0-1ubuntu3
gnustep-base-examples - 1.24.0-1ubuntu3
gnustep-base-runtime - 1.24.0-1ubuntu3
libgnustep-base1.24 - 1.24.0-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnustep-base package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.24.0-1ubuntu3').
